column4: sometimes when i try to run a program that belongs in my home directory (usually a hidden directory), i get a response " ... " is not owned by you
how can i fix this?
paste the exact command
the exact command?
paste exactly what you do and what happens to demonstrate the problem
http://paste.ubuntu.com/20339/
what is the result of command:     ls -l  /home/jacob/ | grep .wine     if its 1 or 2 lines then paste here
best, execute:   sudo chown jacob.jacob  /home/jacob/.wine
this should fix this problem
that wine directory was not owned by you; probably you previously executed wine as root and this caused this problem.  command above should fix it
do the chown which I written and try again to run your program
http://paste.ubuntu.com/20341/
why you do  sudo wine ... ?    try without the sudo.   just    wine Autorun.inf
what happens if you simply try the  wine ./Autorun.inf   without the "sudo" ?    (btw, for harder questions, try asking on ubuntu forums)
the problem is that you do not run Autorun.inf like that.
do:   cat Autorun.inf    and see the name of .exe  to be executed,  then run this exe by hand, like:   wine setup.exe   or  wine someprogram.exe  or whatever it is
ask #winehq about how to run Autorun.inf   or just run the .exe
you are running IRC client as root.  don't do that
run IRC client as normal user, not as root.
want me to re-run?

you are doing something wrong.....   reboot  computer,  open a termianl like  gnome-terminal or aterm   run:  id  (it should show that yu are john or something, NOT root) and then run in it  konversation  or xchat  or whatever client you are using
ok, i'll tell you the results
